intro: Guatteria geminiflora var. ochrantha, commonly known as the orange-flowered guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that turn orange as they mature. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically reddish when ripe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical forests. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique floral display.
